channel.title: joshua on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in joshua on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 88, Joshua 22-24
item.description: With the land subdued and portioned, Joshua sends the eastern tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh back home beyond the Jordan.

item.title: Day 87, Joshua 19-21
item.description: The inheritance for Simeon, Zebulun, Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Dan were given in that order. Of note is the territory of Simeon, as it is within the territory of Judah.

item.title: Day 86, Joshua 16-18
item.description: Joshua continues to allot the land to the people of Israel. Following the allotment of Judah, the tribes Ephraim and Manasseh received their portion.

item.title: Day 85, Joshua 12-15
item.description: Moses defeated the kings east of the Jordan. The land there was given to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

item.title: Day 84, oshua 9-11
item.description: The kings in the land heard of what happened at Ai, and five of them gathered to fight against Israel. However, the Gibeonites deceived Israel into sparing them, showing the dangers of relying on oneself instead of God.

item.title: Day 83, Joshua 5-8
item.description: The people west of the Jordan heard of Israel’s Jordan crossing by God’s hand, and they all lost heart. Remarkably, this was the time when God told Joshua to circumcise the new generation of Israel, since they would be putting themselves in a very vulnerable state in the middle of enemy territory.

item.title: Day 82, Joshua 1-4
item.description: Joshua officially takes over leadership of Israel. God reiterates what he said before to Joshua, but this time in his new capacity as leader.
